# Arpeggio: Minor 7th in F# (Shape: E)

An arpeggio is a musical technique where the notes of a chord are played sequentially rather than simultaneously. In this case, we are looking at the Minor 7th arpeggio in the key of F# using the shape based on the E major scale.

## Notes and Intervals
The Minor 7th arpeggio in F# consists of the following notes and intervals:
1. F# (Root)
2. A (Minor 3rd)
3. C# (Perfect 5th)
4. E (Minor 7th)

## Musical Flavor
The Minor 7th arpeggio in F# (E shape) has a melancholic and jazzy sound. It is often used to create a soulful and smooth vibe in music, commonly found in jazz, blues, or R&B genres. The bittersweet quality of the Minor 7th arpeggio adds depth and emotion to musical compositions.

## Songs
Here are three songs that make use of the Minor 7th arpeggio in F#:
1. "Autumn Leaves" - This jazz standard features the Minor 7th arpeggio in various sections, enhancing the nostalgic and reflective mood of the piece.
2. "The Thrill Is Gone" by B.B. King - The Minor 7th arpeggio in F# is used in this blues classic to convey a sense of longing and resignation.
3. "Isn't She Lovely" by Stevie Wonder - This soulful tune incorporates the Minor 7th arpeggio in F# to add a smooth and sophisticated touch to the melody.
